data.title: "Marriage Scarab" of Amunhotep III and Queen Tiye
data.meta_site_name: Digital Library of the Middle East - DLME
data.text:
Title:

"Marriage Scarab" of Amunhotep III and Queen Tiye

Description:

Blue faience scarab, commemorating the marriage of Amenhotep III with Queen Tiy. The inscription on the underside is inlaid with bluish-white glaze. There are additional inscriptions on two sides, under the legs of the beetle â€“ right) name of Queen Tiy; left) throne name of Amenhotep III. Probably sent to dignitaries of Egypt as announcements. Condition: Good, except for the blowholes in glaze surface, and the wearing away of the bluish white glaze in the hieroglyphs.

Type:

Document

Geographic region:

Egypt

Time period:

New Kingdom

Provenance:

Charles Edwin Wilbour Fund

Medium:

Faience

Extent:

1 1/8 x 1 15/16 x 2 3/4 in. (2.8 x 5 x 7 cm)

Rights:

Creative Commons-BY

Identifier:

Accession Number: 37.475E

Is part of:

Egyptian, Classical, Ancient Near Eastern Art
